pr_title: Store information about case sensitivity in JdbcTypeHandle

timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -340,7 +340,8 @@ private JdbcTypeHandle getArrayElementTypeHandle(JdbcTypeHandle arrayTypeHandle)
                 Optional.of(arrayTypeName),
                 arrayTypeHandle.getColumnSize(),
                 arrayTypeHandle.getDecimalDigits(),
-                arrayTypeHandle.getArrayDimensions());
+                arrayTypeHandle.getArrayDimensions(),
+                arrayTypeHandle.getCaseSensitivity());

replies.bodyText: I think its content could be case sensitive
replies.author: kokosing

timeline.bodyText:
Restore ctor without Optional<CaseSensitivity> for backwards compatibility.
We can mark it deprecated and remove it later, but I would rather go with a builder approach (later).
For now let's just have two (non-deprecated) constructors, because it's not clear which one
should be retained (if any).
timeline.author: findepi
findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -659,7 +660,8 @@ private static JdbcTypeHandle getArrayElementTypeHandle(Connection connection, J
                     Optional.of(typeInfo.getPGType(pgElementOid)),
                     arrayTypeHandle.getColumnSize(),
                     arrayTypeHandle.getDecimalDigits(),
-                    arrayTypeHandle.getArrayDimensions());
+                    arrayTypeHandle.getArrayDimensions(),
+                    arrayTypeHandle.getCaseSensitivity());

replies.bodyText: I think its content could be case sensitive
replies.author: kokosing

replies.bodyText:
i think we are not handling this correctly in any way.
rather, i'd have here verify(arrayTypeHandle.getCaseSensitivity().isEmpty()).
replies.author: findepi

timeline.author: findepi

timeline.message: Store information about case sensitivity in JdbcTypeHandle
Store information about case sensitivity in JdbcTypeHandle
